definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: Our caucus meetings were always the highlight of my week.
sentences.chinese: 我們的國會會議總是我一週中最顯要的部分。

sentences.english: Dignitaries are invited to cut ribbons.
Celia looked down directly at the two executive rows.
sentences.chinese: 西莉亞雙眼徑直望着坐在前兩排的顯要人物。

sentences.english: Long ago, people who were rich or important rode horses that were very tall.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，鉅富顯要們都騎高頭大馬。

sentences.english: He is a very important man.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位地位顯要的人物。

sentences.english: Google is the back-end technology that is suddenly less visible.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌變成了後端技術，突然間變得不那麼顯要了。

sentences.english: He is a former defence secretary of the United States and a grandee of the Democratic Party.
sentences.chinese: 他是美國前國防部長，也是民主黨的顯要人物。

sentences.english: She says that being a somebody is like being a frog.
sentences.chinese: 她認爲成爲顯要人物類似於當一隻青蛙。

sentences.english: His picture was splattered in many papers.
sentences.chinese: 許多報紙都以顯要的位置刊登了他的照片。

sentences.english: The Beijing ambassadorship is one of the highest-profile U.S. diplomatic posts.
sentences.chinese: 駐華大使是美國最顯要的外交職位之一。

sentences.english: The Beijing ambassadorship is one of the highest-profile U.
sentences.chinese: 駐華大使是美國最顯要的外交職位之一。

sentences.english: That's why you don't see dignitaries coming to me and to my meditations.
sentences.chinese: 那也是你不會看見一個顯要人物來我這裏靜心的原因。

sentences.english: Soane's design for the gallery proved highly influential.
sentences.chinese: Soane的設計爲畫廊證明了高度顯要。
